entities.name: ElizaOS
entities.description: ElizaOS is an AI operating system and a software platform under development. It aims to be an infrastructure layer for AI and games, featuring an L2/L3 rollup network and a 'games as oracles' concept. It uses the elizaOS token as a gas token.

entities.name: token migration
entities.description: A process where existing cryptocurrency tokens are exchanged for new ones, often as part of a network upgrade or rebranding. This typically involves a change in blockchain, tokenomics, or contract address.

entities.name: L2/L3 rollup network
entities.description: A Layer 2 or Layer 3 scaling solution for blockchains that bundles transactions off-chain before submitting them as a single batch to the main chain (Layer 1). This aims to improve transaction speed and reduce costs.

entities.name: games as oracles
entities.description: A novel concept for synthetic prediction markets where AI agents and humans play in simulated environments, with the outcomes used as verifiable data feeds (oracles).

entities.name: synthetic prediction markets
entities.description: Markets that allow users to speculate on the outcome of future events. They function similarly to traditional prediction markets but often leverage blockchain technology for transparency and immutability.

entities.name: Twitter
entities.description: A social networking service where users post and interact with messages known as 'tweets'. It is known for its fast-paced, real-time dissemination of information and public conversations.

entities.name: $ai16z
entities.description: A cryptocurrency token, formerly associated with a project, that is undergoing migration to the $elizaOS token. It uses an SPL Contract.

entities.name: $elizaOS
entities.description: The native cryptocurrency token of the ElizaOS platform, used for gas fees on its L2/L3 rollup network. It is designed to have real utility and value capture beyond being a meme token.

entities.name: SAFT
entities.description: Simple Agreement for Future Tokens. A type of agreement used in cryptocurrency fundraising that provides investors with the right to receive tokens in the future. It is similar to a convertible note used in traditional venture capital.

entities.name: centralized exchanges
entities.description: Cryptocurrency exchanges that are operated by a central entity, requiring users to complete KYC/AML verification. They facilitate the buying and selling of digital assets at established market prices.

entities.name: Docker
entities.description: An open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers. Docker enables developers to package an application with all of its dependencies, such as libraries and other system requirements, and ship it as a single software package.

entities.name: Rocky
entities.description: An individual involved in the ElizaOS development community who provided solutions for Docker configuration issues.

entities.name: Shaw
entities.description: An individual who outlined the technical roadmap for ElizaOS, including L2/L3 rollup network development and the 'games as oracles' concept.

entities.name: ERC-4337
entities.description: An Ethereum standard that enables account abstraction, allowing for more flexible and user-friendly transaction execution and fee payment mechanisms on the Ethereum blockchain and compatible networks.

entities.name: ERC-8004
entities.description: An Ethereum Request for Comment standard, likely related to smart contract creation or interaction on the Ethereum blockchain. Specific functionality would require further research.

entities.name: TEEs
entities.description: Trusted Execution Environments. Secure areas within a processor that ensure code and data loaded into them are protected with respect to confidentiality and integrity.

entities.name: Odilitime
entities.description: A community member or developer within the ElizaOS ecosystem who shared a GitHub repository for digital twin plugin development and responded to queries regarding centralized exchange migration.

entities.name: Sam-developer
entities.description: A developer within the ElizaOS platform who demonstrated MCP integration.

entities.name: MCP
entities.description: Unknown - needs research

entities.name: Cloudflare
entities.description: A web infrastructure and security company that provides a content delivery network (CDN), DDoS mitigation, and other web services. It aims to make websites faster and more secure.

entities.name: OpenRouter
entities.description: A platform that provides a unified API gateway for accessing multiple large language models (LLMs), simplifying integration for developers. It offers features like response annotation and improved ID requirements.

entities.name: Base
entities.description: A Layer 2 scaling solution for Ethereum, developed by Coinbase. It aims to provide a secure, low-cost, and developer-friendly environment for decentralized applications.

entities.name: GitHub
entities.description: A web-based platform and version control system for software development, offering tools for code hosting, collaboration, and project management. It uses Git as its core technology.

entities.name: Raydium
entities.description: A decentralized exchange (DEX) and automated market maker (AMM) built on the Solana blockchain. It hosts an intelligent liquidity aggregator and offers features like automated yield farming.

entities.name: Kucoin
entities.description: A global cryptocurrency exchange that offers trading services for a wide range of digital assets. It provides P2P trading, margin trading, and futures trading functionalities.

entities.name: Phantom
entities.description: A cryptocurrency wallet designed primarily for the Solana ecosystem, serving as a browser extension and mobile app. It allows users to store, send, and receive SOL and other SPL tokens, and interact with decentralized applications.

entities.name: Solana
entities.description: An open-source, proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchain platform designed for high performance, scalability, and low transaction costs. It aims to support decentralized applications and cryptocurrencies.

entities.name: SVM
entities.description: Solana Virtual Machine. A blockchain virtual machine that executes smart contracts on the Solana network. It plays a crucial role in enabling the functionality of decentralized applications on Solana.

entities.name: EVM
entities.description: Ethereum Virtual Machine. The runtime environment for smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain. It executes smart contract code and processes transactions.

entities.name: CCIP
entities.description: Cross-Chain Interoperability Protocol. A protocol designed to enable secure communication and token transfer between different blockchains. It is developed by Chainlink.

entities.name: Chainlink
entities.description: A decentralized oracle network that provides real-world data to smart contracts on the blockchain, enabling them to interact with external systems and APIs. It is known for its reliable and secure data feeds.

entities.name: RAG
entities.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation. A technique used in natural language processing to improve the quality of generated text by combining a retrieval system with a language model. The retrieval system fetches relevant information from a knowledge base to inform the generation process.
